{{infobox military unit |unit_name=18th Reconnaissance Regiment |image= |caption= |dates=1 July 2009 – present |country={{flag|Poland|23px}} |allegiance=[[Polish Land Forces]] |branch=Land Forces |type= |role=Reconnaissance |size= |command_structure= |garrison= [[Białystok]] |garrison_label= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |colors_label= |march= |mascot= |equipment= |equipment_label= |battles= |anniversaries= |decorations= |battle_honours= |disbanded= |flying_hours= |website= http://18pr.wp.mil.pl/ <!-- Commanders --> |commander1=Wieslaw Podlecki |commander1_label= Pułkownik dypl. |commander2= |commander2_label= |commander3= |commander3_label= |commander4= |commander4_label= |notable_commanders= <!-- Insignia --> |identification_symbol= |identification_symbol_label= |identification_symbol_2= |identification_symbol_2_label= }} __NOTOC__ '''18th Reconnaissance Regiment''' ({{lang-pl|18 Pułk Rozpoznawczy}}) of the [[Polish Land Forces]] is based in [[Białystok]]. Its heritage was the former 18th Territorial Defense Battalion and prior the former 18th Mechanized Brigade. This is the youngest unit of the Land Forces and one of three Reconnaissance regiments in the Polish army.<ref name="standard">[http://www.18pułkrozpoznawczy.pl/20-18-puk-otrzyma-sztandar 18 białostocki pułk rozpoznawczy otrzymał sztandar] {{pl icon}}</ref>
==History== On April 23, 2009, the unit visited the Polish Minister of National Defense, [[Bogdan Klich]]. During the meeting the Minister informed the soldiers that in February 2009 it was decided to reorganize the battalion, no later than 30 June 2009 and create a reconnaissance regiment. The 18th Reconnaissance Regiment was formed on July 1, 2009.<ref>{{cite book | title=Dziennik Urzędowy Ministra Obrony Narodowej | year=2009}}</ref>
On October 15, 2009 came into force the decision of the Minister of National Defense on the 18th Reconnaissance Regiment permission to use the standard of the 18th Territorial Defense Battalion until 15 August 2010.<ref>Decyzja Nr 309/MON Ministra Obrony Narodowej z dnia 7 września 2009 r. w sprawie czasowego używania sztandaru 18. batalionu obrony terytorialnej przez 18. pułk rozpoznawczy (Dz. U. MON Nr 17 z 30 września 2009 r., poz. 195).</ref>
On 11 November 2010, representatives of the 18th Reconnaissance Regiment, on behalf of the Minister of National Defense [[Bogdan Klich]], paid tribute at the grave of the late [[Ordinary (officer)|Ordinary]] [[Polish Orthodox Church|Orthodox]] archbishop of the [[Polish Land Forces|Polish Army]] [[Miron Chodakowski]]. The delegation, composed of the regiment Lt Col Chris Lenkiewicz, Maj. Slawomir Ratyński and Cpt. Jan Busłowicz on National Day paid tribute to one of those who died in the service of fulfilling the duties of his homeland. The ceremony took place in the crypt church of the Annunciation of the Virgin Mary located in the vicinity of Bialystok in Supraśl.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.army.mil.pl/index.php/aktualnosci/654-kwiaty-w-imieniu-ministra | title=Kwiaty w imieniu Ministra | accessdate=2011-02-01 | publisher=Republic of Poland, Polish Land Forces}}</ref>
On 30 June 2011, the regiment received its regimental standard, from Polish President Bronislaw Komorowski, at a ceremony in Kosciuszko Square, [[Białystok]] before the monument to Marshal [[Józef Piłsudski]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.18pułkrozpoznawczy.pl/historia-2 | title=18th Reconnaissance Regiment Website | publisher=Polish Armed Forces | accessdate=10 November 2013}}</ref>
==Regimental standard== The new standard in addition to the national colors and emblem also exposes the symbolic elements associated with Bialystok coat of arms and contains commemorative badges of merit from the military units formerly stationed at the garrison:<ref name="standard"/> *18th Territorial Defense Battalion and prior the former 18th Mechanized Brigade * 18 Infantry Division ({{lang-pl|18 Dywizji Piechoty}}) * 42 Infantry Regiment im General [[Jan Henryk Dąbrowski]] ({{lang-pl|42 Pułku Piechoty}}) * [[File:Prop 10pul.png|50px|left]] 10 Lithuanian Cavalry Regiment ({{lang-pl|10 Pułku Ułanów Litewskich}}) {{clear}} ==Organization== The regiment has the following internal structure: * Regimental Command Staff * Command Company * Logistics Company * 1st Reconnaissance Company * 2nd Reconnaissance Company * 3rd Reconnaissance Company * 4th Reconnaissance Company * 5th Reconnaissance Company * 6th Reconnaissance Company
